metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25721 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Kerberos acceptors need easy access to stable AD identifiers (eg objectSid). Samba as an AD DC now provides a way for Linux applications to obtain a reliable SID (and samAccountName) in issued tickets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldb-tools - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libldb2 - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
python3-ldb - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

ctdb - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-ad-dc - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-ad-provision - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Fixing this in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS would require substantial code backports. We will not be fixing this issue in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. In environments where this is of concern, we recommend updating to a more recent Ubuntu version.

criterions.comment: samba package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
samba package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
